titleStmt.title: J. T. Eastham et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6361

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Govenor of Kentucky the undersigned petitioners residents and citizens of Boyd county Kentucky would respectfully represent that at the April term of the Boyd Circuit court 1865 a fine was imposed upon our fellow, citizen Thomas Triplett for selling Liquor -- to a minor, the fine was for fifty dollars we are satifsfied that at the selling of the liquor said Thomas Triplett did not know that the person to whome he sold it was a minor but did beleive he was an adult of full age and in fact he was within six or seven weeks of his majority

J T. Eastham
Edwd Courtney
H P. Thomas
Henry Wolf
Geo. N. Osenton
A Bagley
B. Selb.
L. E Veyssie
Jno P. Jones
James Marks
Joseph P Rankin
John Selb
L. E Shepherd
Wm. C. Mayhew
E karns
L. Toliver
D. S Toliver
Wm Scott
Wm Gard
Medzar Wolf

Boyd Cir Ct
vs
Thos Triplett
Refused
